title: fix(svm): delay 1 slot after creating buffer in program deploy
refactor(cli): improve `txtx ls` display
body:
Replace complex string manipulation to:
- use idiomatic Rust patterns (as_deref, lines, find)
- handle multi-line descriptions by finding first non-empty line
- eliminate unnecessary allocations (split/collect/Vec)
- handle edge cases more gracefully (empty descriptions, whitespace-only lines)
- handle cross-platform compatibility with lines() iterator handling \n, \r\n, and \r line endings

fix: improve command descriptions for clarity
body:
This pull request makes improvements to the clarity and consistency of command descriptions in the `Command` enum within the `cli` module. The changes primarily focus on refining phrasing, correcting capitalization, and ensuring uniformity across all command descriptions.

### Improvements to command descriptions:

* Updated descriptions for commands like `List`, `New`, `Check`, `Run`, `Docs`, `Lsp`, `Serve`, and `Cloud` to use clearer and more consistent language. For example, "List runbooks present in the current direcoty" was corrected to "List runbooks in the current directory," and "Run, runbook, run!" was changed to "Execute a runbook."

title: chore(cloud): add queries for workspace; rev cloud crate
fix(svm): fix pda creation for custom program ids in `process_instructions`
Feat/native support
body:
This PR vastly improves the conversion of native/classic IDLs to anchor IDLs.

It also improves the `get_program_from_native_project` fn to only require a program name and to have the same optional args as `get_program_from_anchor_project`.

It includes some fixes for `process_instructions`, and template runbook generators for native programs.

Fixes #265

title: feat(svm): revamp program deployment
body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

## Release Notes

- **New Features**
	- Enhanced transaction signing and deployment capabilities for Solana programs.
	- Improved handling of nested execution and command workflows.
	- Added more flexible signer and transaction management.
	- Introduced new constants for transaction types and improved value manipulation methods.
	- New methods for managing progress bar visibility and action item responses.
	- Added functionality for retrieving signers dynamically and managing scoped values.

- **Improvements**
	- Refined error handling and diagnostic reporting.
	- More robust management of background tasks and action items.
	- Enhanced support for custom transaction types and signing processes.
	- Improved initialization options for status updates and progress tracking.
	- Streamlined handling of command execution and input evaluation.
	- Enhanced logic for evaluating signers and processing nested executions.

- **Bug Fixes**
	- Improved transaction verification and blockhash management.
	- More precise handling of partial and fully signed transactions.
	- Fixed issues with progress bar visibility updates during signing processes.

- **Technical Enhancements**
	- Expanded constants and type definitions.
	- Streamlined command and signer evaluation processes.
	- Added new utility methods for value manipulation and type conversion.

These changes represent a significant update to the transaction and command execution framework, focusing on flexibility, reliability, and improved developer experience.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

title: feat: allow publishing and embedding runbooks
body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

Based on the comprehensive summary, here are the updated release notes:

- **New Features**
	- Added support for embedded runbooks.
	- Enhanced addon management with namespace-based retrieval.
	- Introduced publishable runbook specifications.
	- Expanded command and input evaluation capabilities.
	- Added new subcommand for publishing runbooks.

- **Improvements**
	- Refined runtime and workspace context handling.
	- Improved serialization support for various structs.
	- Enhanced error diagnostics and input processing.
	- Streamlined addon registration mechanisms.

- **Examples**
	- Added new example configurations for EVM deployment scenarios.
	- Demonstrated embedded and embedding runbook patterns.

- **Infrastructure**
	- Updated GitHub workflow caching mechanism.
	- Migrated to a more functional addon retrieval approach.

These release notes capture the high-level changes without revealing implementation details.

title: fix: improve error handling in relayer interface
feat(evm): improve language around EVM deployments
ci: add NHOST_REGION and NHOST_SUBDOMAIN to .env in workflow
change name of cookie from 'hanko' to 'nhost'
body:
This PR is in preparation of merging https://github.com/txtx/txtx-supervisor-ui/pull/51.

When that PR is merged the auth cookie will be named 'nhost' instead of 'hanko' as the authentication is being switched.

title: chore(evm): add abi to deploy contract action outputs
